com.microsoft.windowsazure.management.compute

Interface VirtualMachineExtensionOperations

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VirtualMachineExtensionOperationsImpl

    public interface VirtualMachineExtensionOperations
    The Service Management API includes operations for managing the virtual machine extensions in your subscription. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/jj157206.aspx for more information)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VirtualMachineExtensionListResponse list()
      The List Resource Extensions operation lists the resource extensions that are available to add to a Virtual Machine.
      java.util.concurrent.Future<VirtualMachineExtensionListResponse> listAsync()
      The List Resource Extensions operation lists the resource extensions that are available to add to a Virtual Machine.
      VirtualMachineExtensionListResponse listVersions(java.lang.String publisherName, java.lang.String extensionName)
      The List Resource Extension Versions operation lists the versions of a resource extension that are available to add to a Virtual Machine.
      java.util.concurrent.Future<VirtualMachineExtensionListResponse> listVersionsAsync(java.lang.String publisherName, java.lang.String extensionName)
      The List Resource Extension Versions operation lists the versions of a resource extension that are available to add to a Virtual Machine.

    • Method Detail

      • list

        VirtualMachineExtensionListResponse list()
                                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                                ServiceException,
                                                javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                java.net.URISyntaxException
        The List Resource Extensions operation lists the resource extensions that are available to add to a Virtual Machine. In Azure, a process can run as a resource extension of a Virtual Machine. For example, Remote Desktop Access or the Azure Diagnostics Agent can run as resource extensions to the Virtual Machine. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn495441.aspx for more information)
        Returns:
        The List Resource Extensions operation response.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Thrown if there was a serious configuration error with the document parser.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the XML response.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - Thrown if there was an error parsing a URI in the response.

      • listAsync

        java.util.concurrent.Future<VirtualMachineExtensionListResponse> listAsync()
        The List Resource Extensions operation lists the resource extensions that are available to add to a Virtual Machine. In Azure, a process can run as a resource extension of a Virtual Machine. For example, Remote Desktop Access or the Azure Diagnostics Agent can run as resource extensions to the Virtual Machine. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn495441.aspx for more information)
        Returns:
        The List Resource Extensions operation response.

      • listVersions

        VirtualMachineExtensionListResponse listVersions(java.lang.String publisherName,
                                               java.lang.String extensionName)
                                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                                        ServiceException,
                                                        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                        org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                        java.net.URISyntaxException
        The List Resource Extension Versions operation lists the versions of a resource extension that are available to add to a Virtual Machine. In Azure, a process can run as a resource extension of a Virtual Machine. For example, Remote Desktop Access or the Azure Diagnostics Agent can run as resource extensions to the Virtual Machine. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn495440.aspx for more information)
        Parameters:
        publisherName - Required. The name of the publisher.
        extensionName - Required. The name of the extension.
        Returns:
        The List Resource Extensions operation response.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Thrown if there was a serious configuration error with the document parser.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the XML response.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - Thrown if there was an error parsing a URI in the response.

      • listVersionsAsync

        java.util.concurrent.Future<VirtualMachineExtensionListResponse> listVersionsAsync(java.lang.String publisherName,
                                                                                 java.lang.String extensionName)
        The List Resource Extension Versions operation lists the versions of a resource extension that are available to add to a Virtual Machine. In Azure, a process can run as a resource extension of a Virtual Machine. For example, Remote Desktop Access or the Azure Diagnostics Agent can run as resource extensions to the Virtual Machine. (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dn495440.aspx for more information)
        Parameters:
        publisherName - Required. The name of the publisher.
        extensionName - Required. The name of the extension.
        Returns:
        The List Resource Extensions operation response.
